        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<span class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></span><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<span class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></span><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<span class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <span class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></a><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<span class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></span><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<span class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></span><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></a><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<span class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></span><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></a><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<span class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></span><br>deployed.<span class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<span class="line"><!---->It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<!----></span><br><br>In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate->context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<span class="line"><!---->In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate-&gt;context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<span class="line"><!---->RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<!----></span><br>  HandleScope scope(isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  HandleScope scope(isolate);<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<!----></span><br>  Handle<Object> thrown_object = args.at(0);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Object&gt; thrown_object = args.at(0);<!----></span><br>  Handle<ScopeInfo> scope_info = args.at<ScopeInfo>(1);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;ScopeInfo&gt; scope_info = args.at&lt;ScopeInfo&gt;(1);<!----></span><br>  Handle<Context> current(isolate->context(), isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Context&gt; current(isolate-&gt;context(), isolate);<!----></span><br>  return *isolate->factory()->NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<span class="line"><!---->  return *isolate-&gt;factory()-&gt;NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<!----></span><br>                                              thrown_object);<span class="line"><!---->                                              thrown_object);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<span class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></span><br>v8 Version: commit <span class="line"><!---->v8 Version: commit <!----></span>27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002"><!---->27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<!----></a><br>Operating System: Win64 <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Win64 <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<span class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></span><br>run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<span class="line"><!---->run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<span class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></span><br>Type of crash: [render]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [render]<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br>In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<span class="line"><!---->In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: isolate->context().is_null() || isolate->context().IsContext().<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: isolate-&gt;context().is_null() || isolate-&gt;context().IsContext().<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#FailureMessage Object: 000012D356BF5C40<span class="line"><!---->#FailureMessage Object: 000012D356BF5C40<!----></span><br><br>In release version, it will crash at an access-violation<span class="line"><!---->In release version, it will crash at an access-violation<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==12632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000041414141 (pc         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<span class="line"><!---->More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!----> <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6"><!---->5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<!----></a><br>Author: Jakob Linke <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jakob Linke &lt;<!----></span>jgruber@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jgruber@chromium.org"><!---->jgruber@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<!----></span><br><br>[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<span class="line"><!---->[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<!----></span><br><br>Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<span class="line"><!---->Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<!----></span><br>trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<span class="line"><!---->trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<!----></span><br><br>Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<span class="line"><!---->Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<!----></span><br>complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<span class="line"><!---->complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<!----></span><br>move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<span class="line"><!---->move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<!----></span><br>and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<span class="line"><!---->and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<!----></span><br>We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<span class="line"><!---->We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<!----></span><br>before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<span class="line"><!---->before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<!----></span><br>locations after the main move sequence.<span class="line"><!---->locations after the main move sequence.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: v8:7700<a class="" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        </span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<span class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></span><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<span class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></span><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<span class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <span class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></a><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<span class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></span><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<span class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></span><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></a><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<span class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></span><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></a><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<span class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></span><br>deployed.<span class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<span class="line"><!---->It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<!----></span><br><br>In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate->context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<span class="line"><!---->In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate-&gt;context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<span class="line"><!---->RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<!----></span><br>  HandleScope scope(isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  HandleScope scope(isolate);<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<!----></span><br>  Handle<Object> thrown_object = args.at(0);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Object&gt; thrown_object = args.at(0);<!----></span><br>  Handle<ScopeInfo> scope_info = args.at<ScopeInfo>(1);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;ScopeInfo&gt; scope_info = args.at&lt;ScopeInfo&gt;(1);<!----></span><br>  Handle<Context> current(isolate->context(), isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Context&gt; current(isolate-&gt;context(), isolate);<!----></span><br>  return *isolate->factory()->NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<span class="line"><!---->  return *isolate-&gt;factory()-&gt;NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<!----></span><br>                                              thrown_object);<span class="line"><!---->                                              thrown_object);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<span class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></span><br>v8 Version: commit <span class="line"><!---->v8 Version: commit <!----></span>27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002"><!---->27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<!----></a><br>Operating System: Win64 <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Win64 <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<span class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></span><br>run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<span class="line"><!---->run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<span class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></span><br>Type of crash: [render]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [render]<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br>In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<span class="line"><!---->In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: isolate->context().is_null() || isolate->context().IsContext().<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: isolate-&gt;context().is_null() || isolate-&gt;context().IsContext().<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#FailureMessage Object: 000012D356BF5C40<span class="line"><!---->#FailureMessage Object: 000012D356BF5C40<!----></span><br><br>In release version, it will crash at an access-violation<span class="line"><!---->In release version, it will crash at an access-violation<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==12632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000041414141 (pc 0x7ff7700b56ca bp 0x00adaf5fed60 sp 0x00adaf5fece0 T0)<span class="line"><!---->==12632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000041414141 (pc 0x7ff7700b56ca bp 0x00adaf5fed60 sp 0x00adaf5fece0 T0)<!----></span><br>==12632==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<span class="line"><!---->==12632==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<!----></span><br>==12632==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<span class="line"><!---->==12632==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<!----></span><br>==12632==*** Most likely this means that the app is already      ***<span class="line"><!---->==12632==*** Most likely this means that the app is already      ***<!----></span><br>==12632==*** using DbgHelp, possibly with incompatible flags.    ***<span class="line"><!---->==12632==*** using DbgHelp, possibly with incompatible flags.    ***<!----></span><br>==12632==*** Due to technical reasons, symbolization might crash ***<span class="line"><!---->==12632==*** Due to technical reasons, symbolization might crash ***<!----></span><br>==12632==*** or produce wrong results.                           ***<span class="line"><!---->==12632==*** or produce wrong results.         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<span class="line"><!---->More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

<span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6"><!---->5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<!----></a><br>Author: Jakob Linke <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jakob Linke &lt;<!----></span>jgruber@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jgruber@chromium.org"><!---->jgruber@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<!----></span><br><br>[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<span class="line"><!---->[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<!----></span><br><br>Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<span class="line"><!---->Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<!----></span><br>trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<span class="line"><!---->trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<!----></span><br><br>Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<span class="line"><!---->Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<!----></span><br>complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<span class="line"><!---->complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<!----></span><br>move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<span class="line"><!---->move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<!----></span><br>and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<span class="line"><!---->and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<!----></span><br>We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<span class="line"><!---->We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<!----></span><br>before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<span class="line"><!---->before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<!----></span><br>locations after the main move sequence.<span class="line"><!---->locations after the main move sequence.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: v8:7700<a class="" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>

        This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<span class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></span><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<span class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></span><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<span class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <span class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></a><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<span class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></span><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<span class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></span><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></a><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<span class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></span><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></a><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<span class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></span><br>deployed.<span class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<span class="line"><!---->It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<!----></span><br><br>In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate->context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<span class="line"><!---->In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate-&gt;context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<span class="line"><!---->RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<!----></span><br>  HandleScope scope(isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  HandleScope scope(isolate);<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<!----></span><br>  Handle<Object> thrown_object = args.at(0);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Object&gt; thrown_object = args.at(0);<!----></span><br>  Handle<ScopeInfo> scope_info = args.at<ScopeInfo>(1);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;ScopeInfo&gt; scope_info = args.at&lt;ScopeInfo&gt;(1);<!----></span><br>  Handle<Context> current(isolate->context(), isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Context&gt; current(isolate-&gt;context(), isolate);<!----></span><br>  return *isolate->factory()->NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<span class="line"><!---->  return *isolate-&gt;factory()-&gt;NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<!----></span><br>                                              thrown_object);<span class="line"><!---->                                              thrown_object);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<span class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></span><br>v8 Version: commit <span class="line"><!---->v8 Version: commit <!----></span>27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002"><!---->27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<!----></a><br>Operating System: Win64 <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Win64 <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<span class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></span><br>run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<span class="line"><!---->run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<span class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></span><br>Type of crash: [render]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [render]<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br>In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<span class="line"><!---->In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: isolate->context().is_null() || isolate->context().IsContext().<span access-violation<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span 0x7ff7700b56ca bp 0x00adaf5fed60 sp 0x00adaf5fece0 T0)<span class="line"><!---->==12632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000041414141 (pc 0x7ff7700b56ca bp         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<span class="line"><!---->More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6"><!---->5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<!----></a><br>Author: Jakob Linke <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jakob Linke &lt;<!----></span>jgruber@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jgruber@chromium.org"><!---->jgruber@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<!----></span><br><br>[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<span class="line"><!---->[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<!----></span><br><br>Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<span class="line"><!---->Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<!----></span><br>trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<span class="line"><!---->trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<!----></span><br><br>Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<span class="line"><!---->Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<!----></span><br>complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<span class="line"><!---->complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<!----></span><br>move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<span class="line"><!---->move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<!----></span><br>and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<span class="line"><!---->and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<!----></span><br>We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<span class="line"><!---->We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<!----></span><br>before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<span class="line"><!---->before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<!----></span><br>locations after the main move sequence.<span class="line"><!---->locations after the main move sequence.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: v8:7700<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/v8/issues/detail?id=7700" title="Tracking bug: Maglev"><!---->Bug: v8:7700<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I1734faf189d02e38af07a817a9b647e2dce54f22<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<span class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></span><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<span class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></span><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<span class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <span class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></a><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<span class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></span><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<span class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></span><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></a><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<span class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></span><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></a><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<span class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></span><br>deployed.<span class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<span class="line"><!---->It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<!----></span><br><br>In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate->context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<span class="line"><!---->In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate-&gt;context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<span class="line"><!---->RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<!----></span><br>  HandleScope scope(isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  HandleScope scope(isolate);<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<!----></span><br>  Handle<Object> thrown_object = args.at(0);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Object&gt; thrown_object = args.at(0);<!----></span><br>  Handle<ScopeInfo> scope_info = args.at<ScopeInfo>(1);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;ScopeInfo&gt; scope_info = args.at&lt;ScopeInfo&gt;(1);<!----></span><br>  Handle<Context> current(isolate->context(), isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Context&gt; current(isolate-&gt;context(), isolate);<!----></span><br>  return *isolate->factory()->NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<span class="line"><!---->  return *isolate-&gt;factory()-&gt;NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<!----></span><br>                                              thrown_object);<span class="line"><!---->                                              thrown_object);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<span class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></span><br>v8 Version: commit <span class="line"><!---->v8 Version: commit <!----></span>27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002"><!---->27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<!----></a><br>Operating System: Win64 <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Win64 <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<span class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></span><br>run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<span class="line"><!---->run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<span State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br>In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<span class="line"><!---->In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<span access-violation<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span 0x7ff7700b56ca bp 0x00adaf5fed60 sp 0x00adaf5fece0 T0)<span class="line"><!---->==12632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000041414141 (pc 0x7ff7700b56ca bp         I don't think we're consistent about which labels to set/unset in these cases.         by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      jgruber@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->jgruber@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<span class="line"><!---->More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>

          (was: Assigned)

        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/v8/v8/+/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6"><!---->5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<!----></a><br>Author: Jakob Linke <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jakob Linke &lt;<!----></span>jgruber@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jgruber@chromium.org"><!---->jgruber@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<!----></span><br><br>[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<span class="line"><!---->[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<!----></span><br><br>Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<span class="line"><!---->Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<!----></span><br>trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<span class="line"><!---->trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<!----></span><br><br>Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<span class="line"><!---->Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<!----></span><br>complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<span class="line"><!---->complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<!----></span><br>move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<span class="line"><!---->move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<!----></span><br>and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<span class="line"><!---->and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<!----></span><br>We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<span class="line"><!---->We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<!----></span><br>before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<span class="line"><!---->before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<!----></span><br>locations after the main move sequence.<span class="line"><!---->locations after the main move sequence.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: v8:7700<a class="" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<span class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></span><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<span class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></span><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<span class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></span><br>template.<span class="line"><!---->template.<!----></span><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <span class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></a><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<span class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></span><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<span class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></span><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></a><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<span class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></span><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></a><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<span class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></span><br>deployed.<span class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<span class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></span><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></span><br>It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<span class="line"><!---->It's a type confusion bug in maglev of V8. It can confusion any V8 object as **Context**.<!----></span><br><br>In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate->context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<span class="line"><!---->In `Runtime_PushCatchContext`, when getting `isolate-&gt;context()`, it get a wrong object ,and then confuse it as Context. The wrong object can be controlled as any js object(smi or HeapObject).<!----></span><br>```c++<span class="line"><!---->```c++<!----></span><br>RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<span class="line"><!---->RUNTIME_FUNCTION(Runtime_PushCatchContext) {<!----></span><br>  HandleScope scope(isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  HandleScope scope(isolate);<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_EQ(2, args.length());<!----></span><br>  Handle<Object> thrown_object = args.at(0);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Object&gt; thrown_object = args.at(0);<!----></span><br>  Handle<ScopeInfo> scope_info = args.at<ScopeInfo>(1);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;ScopeInfo&gt; scope_info = args.at&lt;ScopeInfo&gt;(1);<!----></span><br>  Handle<Context> current(isolate->context(), isolate);<span class="line"><!---->  Handle&lt;Context&gt; current(isolate-&gt;context(), isolate);<!----></span><br>  return *isolate->factory()->NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<span class="line"><!---->  return *isolate-&gt;factory()-&gt;NewCatchContext(current, scope_info,<!----></span><br>                                              thrown_object);<span class="line"><!---->                                              thrown_object);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<span class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></span><br>v8 Version: commit <span class="line"><!---->v8 Version: commit <!----></span>27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002"><!---->27d8c2e99378f1ba8e7c24500772d9dab137c002<!----></a><br>Operating System: Win64 <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Win64 <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<span class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></span><br>run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<span class="line"><!---->run the test.js in d8 with flag " --allow-natives-syntax --maglev"<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<span class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></span><br>Type of crash: [render]<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [render]<!----></span><br>Crash State: <span class="line"><!---->Crash State: <!----></span><br>In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<span class="line"><!---->In debug version, it will crash at a DCHECK where checking the correctness of context.<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<span class="line"><!----># Fatal error in ..\..\src\runtime\runtime-scopes.cc, line 600<!----></span><br># Debug check failed: isolate->context().is_null() || isolate->context().IsContext().<span class="line"><!----># Debug check failed: isolate-&gt;context().is_null() || isolate-&gt;context().IsContext().<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#<span class="line"><!---->#<!----></span><br>#FailureMessage Object: 000012D356BF5C40<span class="line"><!---->#FailureMessage Object: 000012D356BF5C40<!----></span><br><br>In release version, it will crash at an access-violation<span class="line"><!---->In release version, it will crash at an access-violation<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==12632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000041414141 (pc 0x7ff7700b56ca bp 0x00adaf5fed60 sp 0x00adaf5fece0 T0)<span class="line"><!---->==12632==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: access-violation on unknown address 0x000041414141 (pc 0x7ff7700b56ca bp 0x00adaf5fed60 sp 0x00adaf5fece0 T0)<!----></span><br>==12632==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<span class="line"><!---->==12632==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<!----></span><br>==12632==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<span class="line"><!---->==12632==*** WARNING: Failed to initialize DbgHelp!              ***<!----></span><br>==12632==*** Most likely this means that the app is already      ***<span class="line"><!---->==12632==*** Most likely this means that the app is already      ***<!----></span><br>==12632==*** using DbgHelp, possibly with incompatible flags.    ***<span class="line"><!---->==12632==*** using DbgHelp, possibly with incompatible flags.         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 28, 2022, 4:24 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<span class="line"><!---->More info: the problem seems to be that {direct,materialising} moves for exception handler trampolines don't consider possible ordering conflicts at all. These may happen though due to stack slot reuse, i.e. an exception phi target may equal another exception phi's source slot. The fix is to use the parallel move resolver for all these moves.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

<span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6"><!---->5646b9c3c0edb2d688603c3de72c382018d449a6<!----></a><br>Author: Jakob Linke <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jakob Linke &lt;<!----></span>jgruber@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jgruber@chromium.org"><!---->jgruber@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Oct 04 09:16:17 2022<!----></span><br><br>[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<span class="line"><!---->[maglev] Use the parallel move resolver for handler trampolines<!----></span><br><br>Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<span class="line"><!---->Due to stack slot reuse, any of the moves that are part of the handler<!----></span><br>trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<span class="line"><!---->trampoline may conflict and thus need parallel move resolution.<!----></span><br><br>Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<span class="line"><!---->Materialisations (= calls to the NewHeapNumber builtin) add an addtl<!----></span><br>complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<span class="line"><!---->complication since a) materialising moves can also be part of any<!----></span><br>move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<span class="line"><!---->move conflict, b) the builtin call may clobber arbitrary registers,<!----></span><br>and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<span class="line"><!---->and c) materialisation need a spot to store the NewHeapNumber result.<!----></span><br>We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<span class="line"><!---->We resolve this by materialising into new temporary stack slots<!----></span><br>before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<span class="line"><!---->before the main move sequence, and popping into the final target<!----></span><br>locations after the main move sequence.<span class="line"><!---->locations after the main move sequence.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: v8:7700<a class="" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.           Comment 1<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1368046#c1">Comment 1<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
